medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive bowing of both legs in a 28-month-old male child.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The bowing of legs was first noticed at 19 months of age and progressively worsened since then. The child did not start walking until 19 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient mother has severe short stature and underwent multiple corrective osteotomies. The mother could not walk independently until 2.5 years of age and exhibited similar bowing of limbs.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's two siblings are healthy; the mother also has a family history of skeletal abnormalities related to Jansen's Metaphyseal Chondrodysplasia.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was born full term to a non-consanguineous couple; not specified if there are any other lifestyle or environmental exposures.
